maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet establishes a connection to a Cloud Services server.

This cmdlet establishes a connection to a Cloud Services server. The cmdlet requires an OAuth security context in order to authenticate the user. If you want to specify an API token directly, use the ApiToken parameter.

When running, the cmdlet performs the following steps: 1. If the Menu parameter is specified, a list of the latest connected VMware Cloud Services servers appears. 2. If neither the Menu nor the server is specified, the default "console.cloud.vmware.com" value is used. 3. If neither the ApiToken parameter nor the OAuthSecurityContext parameter is specified, the local credential store is searched for a previously saved one. If an API token is not found, an error report appears. 4. When using the Server and ApiToken parameters, a new OAuth security context is created for the token and is used to authenticate the user. 5. If the OAuthSecurityContext parameter is specified, you can use the security context to authenticate the user.
Note: If PowerShell runs in non-interactive mode, you are not prompted for credentials.
Specifies the API token you want to use for authentication with the VMware Cloud Services server. The token is obtained from the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
Specifies that you do not want to save the specified servers as default servers (the $global:defaultVcsServers PowerShell variable).
Indicates that the API token that you use for establishing the server session is saved to a local credential store and can be used automatically when connecting again to the same server.

Indicates that you want to select a connection server from a list of recently connected servers. If the Menu parameter is set to $true, the cmdlet retrieves a list of the last visited servers and enters a nested command prompt, so that you can select a server from the list.

Specifies the IP address or the DNS name of the VMware managed cloud service. If not specified, the cmdlet assumes that you are connecting to the public commercial instance and the default value of `console.cloud.vmware.com` is used.
Specifies that you do not want to save the specified servers as default servers (the $global:defaultVcsServers PowerShell variable).

Specifies the OAuth security context that you can use to authenticate the user. For more information about security contexts, see the about_security_context article (about_security_context.html) and the [New-VcsOAuthSecurityContext cmdlet](New-VcsOAuthSecurityContext.md).
Specifies the API token you want to use for authentication with the VMware Cloud Services server. The token is obtained from the VMware Cloud Services web portal.

Indicates that you want to select a connection server from a list of recently connected servers. If the Menu parameter is set to $true, the cmdlet retrieves a list of the last visited servers and enters a nested command prompt, so that you can select a server from the list.
Specifies that you do not want to save the specified servers as default servers (the $global:defaultVcsServers PowerShell variable).

Specifies the OAuth security context that you can use to authenticate the user. For more information about security contexts, see the about_security_context article (about_security_context.html) and the [New-VcsOAuthSecurityContext cmdlet](New-VcsOAuthSecurityContext.md).
Indicates that the API token that you use for establishing the server session is saved to a local credential store and can be used automatically when connecting again to the same server.

Specifies the IP address or the DNS name of the VMware managed cloud service. If not specified, the cmdlet assumes that you are connecting to the public commercial instance and the default value of `console.cloud.vmware.com` is used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to a VMware Cloud Services server.
Connects to a VMware Cloud Services server by specifying the related secure connection token and saving it for later use.
Connects to a VMware Cloud Services server by specifying an OAuth security context. In this case, you can create it by using the API token.

Connects to a VMware Cloud Services server by explicitly specifying the host name of the VMware Cloud Services and the VMware Cloud Services server for the commercial instance. If you want to use a different instance, you can find the corresponding host names in the Developer Center section of the web portal.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet closes the connection to the servers specified by the Server parameter.

This cmdlet closes the connection to the servers specified by the Server parameter. When no servers are specified and if there is only one connected server in the $defaultVcsServers variable, this server is disconnected. If there is no connected server, the cmdlet throws a non-terminating error.
This functionality uses the reference counting mechanism. For more information about the mechanism, see Connect-Vcs.

When there are no more active connections to the server, it gets disconnected and then it is removed from the $defaultVcsServers variable (if it is present). For more information about this variable, see Connect-Vcs.
If the Force parameter is specified, the server is disconnected even if there is more than one connection to it. The RefCount property of the object is incremented by one.
Specifies the VMware Cloud on AWS servers you want to disconnect from.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies that you want to remove all existing connections to the specified VMware Cloud on AWS servers.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies that you want to remove all existing connections to the specified VMware Cloud on AWS servers.
Specifies the VMware Cloud on AWS servers you want to disconnect from.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Disconnects the specified VMware Cloud on AWS server without asking for confirmation.
Forces the disconnect operation for all connected VMware Cloud on AWS servers without asking for confirmation.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves organization roles from the VMware Cloud Services Platform.
This cmdlet retrieves organization roles from the VMware Cloud Services Platform.
Specifies the IDs of the organization roles you want to retrieve.

Specifies the VMware Cloud Services Platform servers on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-Vcs cmdlet.
Specifies the names of the organization roles you want to retrieve.

Specifies the VMware Cloud Services Platform servers on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-Vcs cmdlet.
Specifies the users whose organization roles you want to retrieve.
Specifies the IDs of the organization roles you want to retrieve.
Specifies the names of the organization roles you want to retrieve.

Specifies the VMware Cloud Services Platform servers on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-Vcs cmdlet.
Specifies the users whose organization roles you want to retrieve.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the organization role with an "OrganizationRoleId" ID.
Retrieves the organization role with an "OrganizationRoleName" name.
Retrieves the organization roles of $USER user.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an OAuth2 security context object that you can use to authenticate a user with any VMware Cloud Service.
Creates an OAuth2 security context object that you can use to authenticate a user with any VMware Cloud Service.
For more information about security contexts, see the about_security_context article.
This command supports the following authentication options: - authenticate as a user who operates with the specified API token from the VMware Cloud Services web portal.

- authenticate as a user by going to the VMware Cloud Services web portal and providing the credentials of the Web App registered with the VMware Cloud Services web portal. For this operation, you need to create a Web App in the VMware Cloud Services web portal with a redirect URL that is on a localhost and uses the http schema and a port that is free on the machine where PowerCLI is running. When you create the Web App in the web portal, take note of the App ID and secret.

- authenticate as a service application by using the credentials of a Service-To-Service App. For this operation, you need to create a Service-to-Service App in the the VMware Cloud Services server. When you create the Service-to-Service application, add the application to the organization where you want it to operate. Take note of the App ID and secret.

Specifies the host name of the VMware Cloud Services API endpoint for the particular instance. The default value is `console.cloud.vmware.com`. You can find the value for your particular instance in the Developer Center section of the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
Specifies the API token you want to use for authentication with the VMware Cloud Services server. The token is obtained from the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
If specified, any errors with the SSL certificate of the server are ignored.

Specifies the host name of the VMware Cloud Services API endpoint for the particular instance. The default value is `console.cloud.vmware.com`. You can find the value for your particular instance in the Developer Center section of the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
Specifies the ID of an OAuth App registered in the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
Specifies the secret of an OAuth App registered in the VMware Cloud Services web portal. You can retrieve the secret from the portal only when you create the application.
If specified, any errors with the SSL certificate of the server are ignored.
Specifies the ID of the organization where the access tokens from the security context are valid for. You can see the organization ID in the VMware Cloud Services web portal.

Specifies the Redirect URL of the Web App that you created in the VMware Cloud Services web portal for PowerCLI. This URL must be on localhost and a free port on the machine where PowerCLI is running. This URL must use the http schema.

Specifies the host name of the VMware Cloud Services API endpoint for the particular instance. The default value is `console.cloud.vmware.com`. You can find the value for your particular instance in the Developer Center section of the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
Specifies the ID of an OAuth App registered in the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
Specifies the secret of an OAuth App registered in the VMware Cloud Services web portal. You can retrieve the secret from the portal only when you create the application.
If specified, any errors with the SSL certificate of the server are ignored.
Specifies the ID of the organization where the access tokens from the security context are valid for. You can see the organization ID in the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
Specifies the API token you want to use for authentication with the VMware Cloud Services server. The token is obtained from the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
Specifies the ID of an OAuth App registered in the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
Specifies the secret of an OAuth App registered in the VMware Cloud Services web portal. You can retrieve the secret from the portal only when you create the application.
If specified, any errors with the SSL certificate of the server are ignored.
Specifies the ID of the organization where the access tokens from the security context are valid for. You can see the organization ID in the VMware Cloud Services web portal.

Specifies the Redirect URL of the Web App that you created in the VMware Cloud Services web portal for PowerCLI. This URL must be on localhost and a free port on the machine where PowerCLI is running. This URL must use the http schema.

Specifies the host name of the VMware Cloud Services API endpoint for the particular instance. The default value is `console.cloud.vmware.com`. You can find the value for your particular instance in the Developer Center section of the VMware Cloud Services web portal.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an OAuth2 security context object by authenticating the user with an API token from the VMware Cloud Services web portal.

Creates an OAuth2 security context object by authenticating the user with an API token from the VMware Cloud Services web portal for a particular instance of the service. In this example, that is the public commercial instance at https://console.cloud.vmware.com.
Creates an OAuth2 security context object by authenticating as a service application using the credentials of a Service-To-Service App registered with the VMware Cloud Services web portal.
Creates an OAuth2 security context object by authenticating through the VMware Cloud Services web portal and providing the credentials of a Web App.

For this operation, you need to create a Web App in the VMware Cloud Services web portal: 1. Specify for the Redirect URL the value 'http://localhost:8877/powercli'. 2. Specify the permissions for the App (these permissions would be applied to the access tokens produced by the security context). 3. Copy the App ID and App Secret and store them in such a way that allows you to pass those values to your PowerShell script.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet creates а new user invitation on the VMware Cloud Services Platform.

This cmdlet creates а new user invitation on the VMware Cloud Services Platform. If no pending invitation is created, the user might be registered. You can check if the user is added successfully by using the Get-VcsUser cmdlet.
Specifies the emails of the users you want to invite.
Specifies the organization roles which you want to apply for the user.

Specifies the VMware Cloud Services Platform servers on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-Vcs cmdlet.
Specifies the service roles that you want to apply for the user.
Specifies the emails of the users you want to invite.
Specifies the organization roles which you want to apply for the user.

Specifies the VMware Cloud Services Platform servers on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-Vcs cmdlet.
Specifies the service roles that you want to apply for the user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new user invitation for the user with an email "email@mail.com". Users organization roles are $organizationRoles. Users service roles are $serviceRoles.

This cmdlet removes a user from the VMware Cloud Services Platform.
Specifies the user that you want to remove.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.

Specifies the VMware Cloud Services Platform servers on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-Vcs cmdlet.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.

Specifies the VMware Cloud Services Platform servers on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-Vcs cmdlet.
Specifies the user that you want to remove.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the specified $USER user from the VMware Cloud Services Platform.

Specifies the user invitation that you want to revoke.

Specifies the VMware Cloud Services Platform servers on which you want to run the cmdlet. If no value is provided or $null value is passed to this parameter, the command runs on the default servers. For more information about default servers, see the description of the Connect-Vcs cmdlet.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
